decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures like Preacher of the Schism, Cecil, Dark Knight, and Azure Beastbinder. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Shoot the Sheriff and Spyglass Siren to control the board. Tishana's Tidebinder and Soulstone Sanctuary provide additional support and protection. Enduring Curiosity and Long Goodbye provide card advantage to maintain pressure. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption while maintaining control of the game tempo.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by efficiently utilizing a mix of cheap and powerful creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes a combination of evasive creatures, direct damage spells, and card draw options to maintain pressure and control the battlefield. The deck also includes cards that allow for flexibility and adaptability in different situations, ensuring that it can maintain momentum and continually push towards victory. Overall, the strategy revolves around fast-paced, high-energy gameplay to dominate the game and secure a win.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the board through a combination of removal spells and counterspells while digging through the deck for key combo pieces and resources with cards like Mystical Teachings and Consult the Star Charts. Using powerful finishers like Ultima and Jeskai Revelation, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent, eventually overwhelming them with card advantage and powerful spells. The mana base is designed to provide the necessary colors for the spells while also ensuring a consistent stream of resources throughout the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive tactics with a mono black theme, aiming to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It includes a mix of removal spells, creature cards with various abilities, and enchantments to support the aggressive playstyle. The main strategy is to control the board early on with removal spells like Tragic Trajectory and Shoot the Sheriff, while deploying aggressive creatures like Bloodletter of Aclazotz and Demon Wall to deal damage swiftly. The deck aims to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of creatures with evasion abilities and removal spells to maintain board control and pressure the opponent's life total. By combining powerful evasive creatures like Spyglass Siren and Floodpits Drowner with removal spells like Tragic Trajectory and Shoot the Sheriff, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total while keeping their own board clear of threats. The inclusion of cards like Enduring Curiosity and Tishana's Tidebinder also provides card advantage and helps to maintain momentum throughout the game.

Utilizing cheap spells and creatures to quickly deal damage and overwhelm the opponent. The deck focuses on aggression and tempo, using cards like Vivi Ornitier and Stormchaser's Talent to push damage through while controlling the board with Torch the Tower and Riverpyre Verge. Ral, Crackling Wit provides additional card draw and damage potential, while Consult the Star Charts and Astrologian's Planisphere help dig for key pieces. The deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent can establish a strong defense.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and spells, utilizing a combination of blue and red cards. The deck focuses on efficiently dealing damage to the opponent while controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy. With a mix of creatures that have strong abilities and spells that can deal direct damage or manipulate the game state, this deck aims to quickly build up a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent, forcing them to react defensively and struggle to keep up with the tempo of the game.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to control the game by utilizing a variety of cards to disrupt the opponent's strategy and build up card advantage. The deck includes card draw, removal spells, counter magic, and powerful creatures like Marang River Regent and Elspeth, Storm Slayer to maintain control of the board. It also includes cards like Consult the Star Charts and Stock Up to help with resource management and consistency. By denying the opponent opportunities and maintaining a strong board presence, this deck aims to outlast and outplay its opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively control the game by using a combination of disruptive spells like Tragic Trajectory and Nowhere to Run, along with efficient creatures like Desecration Demon and Sunpearl Kirin. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent while maintaining card advantage with cards like Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber. By combining strong tempo plays with disruptive elements, the Orzhov Aggro archetype seeks to overwhelm the opponent and secure victories through strategic combat and resource management.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature strategies and efficient removal to control the board and pressure the opponent. By combining powerful creatures like Cecil, Dark Knight and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares with disruptive spells like Tragic Trajectory and Phantom Interference, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Utilizing a mix of evasion, card draw, and tempo plays, this deck looks to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize and turn the tide in your favor.

The key concept of the deck revolves around utilizing aggressive creatures like Marauding Mako and Vivi Ornitier, supported by powerful spells such as Fear of Missing Out and Winternight Stories. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with a combination of creature pressure and direct damage, while also utilizing card advantage tools like Proft's Eidetic Memory to maintain tempo. The inclusion of cards like Abrade and Torch the Tower helps deal with opposing threats efficiently, while the mana base allows for consistent access to both blue and red spells for maximum flexibility in gameplay.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game through a combination of removal spells, card draw, and powerful creatures. By using cards like Duress and deadly cover-up, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up its own resources. Elspeth, Storm Slayer and the creatures Ketramose, the New Dawn and Beza, the Bounding Spring provide additional threats on the board. The lands in the deck are carefully chosen to ensure the mana base is stable and consistent. With a mix of control elements and threats, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver its opponents.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of card draw, disruption, and removal spells. By using cards like Consult the Star Charts and Meticulous Archive to draw cards and find answers, along with spells like Get Lost and Seam Rip to disrupt the opponent's strategies, the deck aims to outlast the opponent until it can finish the game with powerful finishers like Marang River Regent and Ultima. The key strategy is to stall the game out and gradually gain control over the board to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. Using cards like Sarkhan, Dragon Ascendant and Nova Hellkite to deal massive damage, while also utilizing Magda, the Hoardmaster to generate additional resources. With a strong curve and consistent threats, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, cards like Soulstone Sanctuary and Maelstrom of the Spirit Dragon provide some late-game reach and card advantage to ensure the deck doesn't run out of steam.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Gloomlake Verge and Floodpits Drowner to control the board, while deploying powerful creatures like Cecil, Dark Knight and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to apply pressure, you can quickly outpace your opponent. Additionally, cards like Shoot the Sheriff and Tragic Trajectory provide removal options to deal with threats, allowing you to maintain control of the game and secure victory. With a focus on tempo and aggression, this deck aims to close out games quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and maintain board control. By combining powerful creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Sunpearl Kirin with cards like Stock Up and Nowhere to Run, the deck aims to establish a strong presence on the battlefield early on and keep the pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Cryogen Relic and Spyglass Siren also allows for disruption of the opponent's strategies, making it difficult for them to mount a defense.
